default: (a) {@item chain mail|phb} or (b) {@item scale mail|phb} and {@item shield|phb}
(a) any {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and a {@item shield|phb} or (b) two {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb} or (c) a {@item priest's pack|phb}
(a) {@item Studded Leather Armor|xphb} or (b) {@item Leather Armor|xphb}, {@item Light Crossbow|xphb} with 20 {@item bolt|xphb|Bolts} and a {@item Crossbow Bolt Case|xphb}.
(a) a {@item Scholar's Pack|xphb} or (b) an {@item Explorer's Pack|xphb} or (c) a {@item Priest's Pack|xphb}
(a) a {@item wooden staff|phb} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a {@item shortbow|phb} and {@item arrows (20)|phb|20 arrows} or (b) 5 {@item javelin|phb|javelins}
(a) a {@item priest's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

classFeature.name: Champion's Symbol
entries: {@i 1st-level feature}
You bear the symbol of a cause for which you Champion, be it a Deity, your hometown or a monarch you wear the symbol with pride.
Perhaps you wish to destroy the evil that plagued your home, to spread the will of your God, or you are a valiant defender of those who rule or who you believe should.
You are able to cast the {@spell Compelled Duel} spell a number of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. Your Spellcasting ability for this spell is Charisma.
At 1st level, you may choose your focus as a Champion: Deities, Townships, or Crowns. The subclass you choose grants you unique abilities at higher levels.

items.name: Deities
entries: You are the Champion of a powerful Deity whose power you can channel to aid your allies or harm your foes.

items.name: Townships
entries: You are a Champion of the people, you bring great morale to your party and provide boons to your allies in battle

items.name: Crowns
entries: You are a Champion of someone you deem a worthy leader, becoming their personal guard and assisting them with their cause.

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: {@i 1st-level feature}

Your training with weapons allows you to use the {@variantrule weapon mastery properties|XPHB} of two kinds of {@filter Simple|items|type=simple weapon} or {@filter Martial|items|type=martial weapon} of your choice with which you have proficiency. You can change these on a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: {@i 2nd-level feature}
You gain a {@filter Fighting Style|feats|category=FS} feat of your choice.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 4th-level feature}
You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Champion levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Challenger's Advantage
entries: You have become an experienced duelist, always one step ahead of your enemies.
You are now able to cast {@spell Compelled Duel} three times per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} with your first {@action Attack} against the dueled target.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 8th-level feature}
You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Champion levels 12 and 16.

classFeature.name: Glory and Honor
entries: You demand the highest standard of honor in a duel.
Your {@spell Compelled Duel} spell no longer requires {@status Concentration}.
Creatures have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} against resisting your Compelled Duel spell.
You cannot target any other creature while in a duel.

classFeature.name: Heroic Strength
entries: You are a hero of your cause, willing and ready to defend it at all times.
You can attack three times instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

You are able to do this an amount of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus. This is restored upon a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, or an amount equal to half rounded down on a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 12th-level feature}
You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Champion level 16.

classFeature.name: Will of the Champion
entries: Your willpower to pursue and defend your beliefs is unmatched.
You are immune to {@condition Charmed} condition.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 16th-level feature}
You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: {@i 19th-level feature}
You gain an Epic Boon feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 1st-level feature}
You gain features from your chosen Champion subclass.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 3rd-level feature}
You gain features from your chosen Champion subclass.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 7th-level feature}
You gain additional features from your subclass.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 14th-level feature}
You gain additional features from your subclass.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 20th-level feature}
You gain additional features from your subclass.

classFeature.name: Death's Companion
entries: {@i 1st-level feature}
Even those who dabble in undeath need a companion.
You learn the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell which you are able to cast without Material requirements.
This does not count against your prepared spells.
The only familiar you can find however is a {@creature Crawling Claw|XMM}

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: {@i 1st-level feature}
You have learned to channel the energy of your spiritual guides and embrace the power of storms.
{@i {@b Cantrips:}} You know two {@variantrule Cantrip|XPHB|Cantrips} at Level 1 selected from the {@filter Necromancer spell list|spells|level=0|class=Necromancer (KYVN)}.
{@i {@b Spell Slots:}} The leveling table above shows your spell slots for Level 1+ spells, you regain spell slots on a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

{@i {@b Prepared Spells of Level 1+:}} You prepare the list of Level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose two level 1 spells from the {@filter Necromancer spell list|spells|level=1|class=Necromancer (KYVN)}.

{@i {@b Changing Your Prepared Spells:}} When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change your list of Prepared Spells, replacing any other Necromancer spells for which you have spell slots.
{@i {@b Spellcasting Ability:}} Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your Necromancer spells.
{@i {@b Spellcasting Focus:}} You can use an {@item Arcane Focus|XPHB} for your Necromancer spells.

classFeature.name: Absorb Death
entries: {@i 2nd-level feature}
{@i {@b Duration:}} 1 minute
{@i {@b Material:}} 1 {@item Bone|KyvumsNecromancer|Bone}
You can perform a dark ritual for 1 minute to absorb the remaining life force from a creature's remains.
The corpse must be from a creature that was living and thus cannot be a Construct or Undead.
At the end of it, you regain expended Necromancer spell slots but no more than a number equal to half your maximum (round up).
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 3rd-level feature}
You gain features from your chosen Necromancer subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 4th-level feature}
You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Necromancer levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 6th-level feature}
You gain features from your chosen Necromancer subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 4th-level feature}
You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Necromancer levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Soul Link
entries: {@i 9th-level feature}
You are able to use the remaining life force from a freshly deceased corpse to form a link of vitality with your {@creature Crawling Claw|XMM} from the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell.
The corpse must be from a creature that was living and thus cannot be a Construct or Undead.
Your {@creature Crawling Claw|XMM} Familiar's hit points are now linked with yours causing you to take hit point damage in place of it.
The {@creature Crawling Claw|XMM} can never take above it's maximum hit points in damage.
Additionally, your {@creature Crawling Claw|XMM} Familiar's damage is increased by an amount equal to your Intelligence modifier.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 10th-level feature}
You gain features from your chosen Necromancer subclass.

classFeature.name: Essence Rip
entries: {@i 11th-level feature}
Necromantic spells that you cast drain the very essence of a living creature's being.
Your Necromancy spells that deal damage to the living deal additional damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 4th-level feature}
You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Necromancer levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Necromantic Knowledge
entries: {@i 13th-level feature}
Your study of the Necromantic arts has led to a fruitful discovery.
You can learn two Necromancy spells of your choice from any spellbook of 7th Level or lower.
You are able to change the spell choice upon leveling up.
You are able to cast one of these spells once without expending a spell slot per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 14th-level feature}
You gain features from your chosen Necromancer subclass.

classFeature.name: Soul Recovery
entries: {@i 14th-level feature}

Using the corpse of a recently living creature, you are able to restore one use of your spell from {@classFeature Necromantic Knowledge|Necromancer|KyvumsNecromancer|13|KyvumsNecromancer|Necromantic Knowledge}.
The corpse must be from a creature that was living and thus cannot be a Construct or Undead.
You are also only able to do this twice per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 4th-level feature}
You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Necromancer levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Undeath's Discovery
entries: {@i 17th-level feature}
You have further unraveled the mysteries of undeath.
The spells from your {@classFeature Necromantic Knowledge|Necromancer|KyvumsNecromancer|13|KyvumsNecromancer|Necromantic Knowledge} feature can now be of 9th Level or lower.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: {@i 19th-level feature}
You gain an Epic Boon feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Master of Necromancy
entries: {@i 20th-level feature}
You are now able to learn a third spell from the {@classFeature Necromantic Knowledge|Necromancer|KyvumsNecromancer|13|KyvumsNecromancer|Necromantic Knowledge} feature.
Additionally you can use the {@classFeature Soul Recovery|Necromancer|KyvumsNecromancer|15|KyvumsNecromancer|Soul Recovery} feature a third time before needing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: {@i 1st-level feature}
You have learned to channel the energy of your spiritual guides and embrace the power of storms.
{@i {@b Cantrips:}} You know one {@variantrule Cantrip|XPHB|Cantrip} at Level 1 selected from the {@filter Shaman spell list|spells|level=0|class=Shaman (KYVS)}.
{@i {@b Spell Slots:}} The leveling table above shows your spell slots for Level 1+ spells, you regain spell slots on a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

{@i {@b Prepared Spells of Level 1+:}} You prepare the list of Level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose two level 1 spells from the {@filter Shaman spell list|spells|level=1|class=Shaman (KYVS)}.

{@i {@b Changing Your Prepared Spells:}} When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change your list of Prepared Spells, replacing any other Shaman spells for which you have spell slots.

{@i {@b The Call:}} Using a Call will require an {@variantrule Action|XPHB} unless specified otherwise,  as well as consume a Call slot. You regain all your Call slots on a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or half with a minimum of 1 on a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.
{@i {@b Spellcasting Ability:}} Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Shaman spells.
{@i {@b Spellcasting Focus:}} You can use a {@item Druidic Focus|XPHB} or Crafted {@item Totem|KyvumsShaman} as a Spellcasting Focus for your Shaman spells.

classFeature.name: The Call
entries: {@i 1st-level feature}
You can Call upon the spirits to issue boons or hindrances. Each Call takes an {@variantrule Action|XPHB} unless specified otherwise.
You regain all expended uses of Calls when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or half as much rounded down on a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.

entries.caption: The Call
rows: {@classFeature Call of the Tribe|Shaman|KyvumsShaman|1|KyvumsShaman|Call of the Tribe}
{@classFeature Call of the Wind|Shaman|KyvumsShaman|1|KyvumsShaman|Call of the Wind}
{@classFeature Call of the Spirits|Shaman|KyvumsShaman|7|KyvumsShaman|Call of the Spirits}

classFeature.name: Call of the Tribe
entries: {@i 1st-level feature}
Channel ancestral spirits to bolster your allies or hinder your enemies.
{@i {@b Radius:}} 30ft
{@i {@b Duration:}} 1 minute
{@b Choose one effect:}
You give up to 5 allies including yourself {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your proficiency bonus.

You force up to 3 enemies to roll a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} against your Spellcaster DC, if they fail they will have their {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} reduced by half of your proficiency bonus rounded down.

classFeature.name: Call of the Wind
entries: {@i 2nd-level feature}
Call forth the power of the wind to manifest itself on the battlefield.
{@i {@b Range:}} 30ft
{@i {@b Duration:}} 1 minute
{@i {@b Radius:}} 10ft Cube
{@b Choose a trajectory for powerful winds to beat down.}
All creatures Large or smaller facing against the wind will have their movement speed reduced by 5ft and will be unable to gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on their melee attacks.
All creatures Large or smaller facing the same direction as the wind will have their movement speed increased by 5ft and cannot have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} imposed on their melee attacks.
Non-magical projectiles will also have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} when fired into the wind regardless of direction. The wind also can push any objects weighing less than 70lbs.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 3rd-level feature}
You gain features from your chosen Shaman subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 4th-level feature}
You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Shaman levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Return of the Spirits
entries: {@i 5th-level feature}

Once on each of your turns, if you have no uses of {@classFeature The Call|Shaman|KyvumsShaman|1|KyvumsShaman|The Call} left, you can give yourself one by expending a spell slot (no {@variantrule Action|XPHB} required).

In addition, you can expend one use of {@classFeature The Call|Shaman|KyvumsShaman|1|KyvumsShaman|The Call} (no {@variantrule Action|XPHB} required) to give yourself a level 1 spell slot, but you can’t do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 6th-level feature}
You gain additional features from your subclass.

classFeature.name: Call of the Spirits
entries: {@i 7th-level feature}
Call forth the power of powerful spirits to guide you and your allies or devastate your foes.
{@i {@b Range:}} 30ft
{@i {@b Duration:}} 1 minute
{@b Choose one:}
Up to 5 allies including yourself are granted the assistance of your spiritual guides, each ally will receive a bonus to their {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB} by {@dice 1d4}.
Up to 3 enemies to be hindered by the spirits, each enemy will have their {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB} reduced by {@dice 1d4}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 8th-level feature}
You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Shaman levels 12 and 16.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 10th-level feature}
You gain additional features from your subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 12th-level feature}
You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Shaman level 16.

classFeature.name: Empowered Calls
entries: {@i 15th-level feature}
The spirits reverberate the power of your Calls
Your Calls last twice as long.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: {@i 16th-level feature}
You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Shaman levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 18th-level feature}
You gain additional features from your subclass.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: {@i 19th-level feature}
You gain an Epic Boon feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: {@i 20th-level feature}
You gain additional features from your subclass.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: {@i 1st-level Deities feature}

You gain spellcasting. Select two {@filter Cantrips|spells|level=0|subclass=Champion: Deities (KYVC)} and {@filter 1st level spells|spells|level=1|subclass=Champion: Deities (KYVC)} from the {@filter Champion of Deities spell list.|spells|subclass=Champion: Deities (KYVC)}

subclassFeature.name: Holy Ward
entries: {@i 3rd-level Deities feature}
{@i {@b Range:}} 60ft
You can project a protective ward channelled through the power of your deity on an ally.
The recipient of your Holy Ward gains +1 AC.
{@i {@b You can only have one Holy Ward active at a time.}}

subclassFeature.name: Projected Touch
entries: {@i 7th-level Deities feature}
Your {@subclassFeature Holy Ward|Champion|KyvumsChampion|Deities|KyvumsChampion|3|KyvumsChampion|Holy Ward} now is a capable extension of your power, echoing your reach to whom it is guarding.

You can deliver touch spells through your {@subclassFeature Holy Ward|Champion|KyvumsChampion|Deities|KyvumsChampion|3|KyvumsChampion|Holy Ward}. This can also be used to cast offensive touch spells to enemies within 5ft of your warded ally.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Resurgence
entries: {@i 14th-level Deities feature}
The {@subclassFeature Holy Ward|Champion|KyvumsChampion|Deities|KyvumsChampion|3|KyvumsChampion|Holy Ward} now acts as a link between the vitality of you and the ally you are protecting.
Your warded ally receives a healing equal to half of the healing you give yourself, and you also receive healing equal to half of that which you give to your warded ally.

subclassFeature.name: Ascendant Vessel
entries: {@i 20th-level Deities feature}
Your devotion to your Deity has earned you the special attention of them. Truly anointed the Champion of your deity it blesses you with a fraction of it's power permanently.
Depending on the alignment of your Deity you receive the following bonus:

items.name: Good
entries: You gain a permanent +4 to Constitution and have {@variantrule resistance|XPHB} to damage from Evil creatures.
The {@variantrule resistance|XPHB} also applies to allies under the effects of your Ward, you also can now ward an additional ally.

items.name: Neutral
entries: You gain a permanent +2 to Constitution and +2 to Strength and have {@variantrule resistance|XPHB} to damage from Neutral creatures.
The {@variantrule resistance|XPHB} also applies to allies under the effects of your Ward, you also can now ward an additional ally.

items.name: Evil
entries: You gain a permanent +4 to Strength and have {@variantrule resistance|XPHB} to damage from Good creatures.
The {@variantrule resistance|XPHB} also applies to allies under the effects of your Ward, you also can now ward an additional ally.

subclassFeature.name: Guiding Voice
entries: {@i 1st-level Townships feature}
Gain access to Shouts, commands that are used to assist your allies in combat.

You gain an amount of Shout uses per day as per the Class Progression table, these uses are restored fully on a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or half rounded down with a minimum of 1 on a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.

{@b Guiding Shout:} You can use the {@action Help|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} and can directly use it to assist an ally within 20ft of you on their next {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Bolster the Ranks
entries: {@i 3rd-level Townships feature}
{@i {@b Radius:}} 120ft
{@i {@b Duration:}} 1 minute
{@i {@b Allies must be able to hear you to receive these effects.}}
You shout inspirational words, perhaps meaningful to only your allies raising their morale.
Each ally who hears you gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal your Champion level multipled by your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Rallying Cry
entries: {@i 7th-level Townships feature}
{@i {@b Radius:}} 120ft
{@i {@b Allies must be able to hear you to receive these effects.}}
You shout a short tactical command at your allies, rallying them together to fight cohesively.

items.name: Offensive Command
entries: If you shout an offensive command, for example telling your allies to focus a target:
All attacks against that target gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} until your next turn.

items.name: Defensive Command
entries: If you shout a defensive command, for example telling your allies to guard a target or hold a position:
All allies receive +1 {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} until your next turn.

items.name: Movement Command
entries: If you shout a movement command, for example telling your allies to rush to a target or retreat:
All allies gain 5ft movement until your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Unyielding Heart
entries: {@i 14th-level Townships feature}
You are hardened by battle and a will to protect your companions. You are able to put your fears aside to stay standing in the frontlines.
You are immune to the effects of the {@condition Frightened} condition.

Any ally who witnesses a creature attempt to {@condition Frightened|XPHB|Frighten} you will gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|Saving Throws} against the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition as well as the effects of {@subclassFeature Bolster The Ranks|Champion|KyvumsChampion|Townships|KyvumsChampion|1|KyvumsChampion|Bolster The Ranks}.

subclassFeature.name: Hero of the People
entries: {@i 20th-level Townships feature}
You are a renowned hero across the lands of commonfolk, a defender of all who need it.

Your very presence improves the morale of those around you, friendly creatures within 30ft of you receive half of the benefit of {@subclassFeature Bolster The Ranks|Champion|KyvumsChampion|Townships|KyvumsChampion|3|KyvumsChampion|Bolster The Ranks}.
This effect cannot be reapplied during combat without actively using {@subclassFeature Bolster The Ranks|Champion|KyvumsChampion|Townships|KyvumsChampion|3|KyvumsChampion|Bolster The Ranks}.

subclassFeature.name: Royal Guardian
entries: {@i 1st-level Crowns feature}
You are able to designate one ally as your ward, devoting yourself to their cause and vowing to defend them at all costs.
You are only able to designate a new ward if; the previous one dies, there is a strong moral disagreement, upon leveling up.
Choose one of either the {@feat Protection|XPHB} Fighting Style or {@feat Interception|XPHB} Fighting Style to learn.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Goal
entries: {@i 3rd-level Crowns feature}
You are able to use the {@action Help|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} when assisting your Ward.

subclassFeature.name: Critical Vengeance
entries: {@i 7th-level Crowns feature}
If your Ward is below maximum hitpoints and you are within 60ft of them, you gain 10ft of movement.
Additionally, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attacks against any creature that damaged your Ward in the last round.

subclassFeature.name: Stalwart Defender
entries: {@i 14th-level Crowns feature}
If your Ward is below half hitpoints and you are within 5ft of them, you are able to use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to defend them with your body.

Using your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB}, you now occupy the same space as your Ward intercepting attacks made against them. You receive a -2 penalty to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} while doing this.
You also will take full damage from {@variantrule Area of Effect|XPHB} damage that would hit you, and half of which would affect your Ward - they receive the other half.

subclassFeature.name: Crown’s Bulwark
entries: {@i 20th-level Crowns feature}
You become the ultimate bulwark, capable of shielding your Ward from all harm.

When you are within 5ft of your Ward they always have the benefit of your Fighting Style choice from {@subclassFeature Royal Guardian|Champion|KyvumsChampion|Crowns|KyvumsChampion|1|KyvumsChampion|Royal Guardian} so long as you meet the requirements to do so.

Additionally, when using the {@subclassFeature Stalwart Defender|Champion|KyvumsChampion|Crowns|KyvumsChampion|14|KyvumsChampion|Stalwart Defender} feature you no longer receive a penalty to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} and your ward no longer receives damage from {@variantrule Area of Effect|XPHB} effects.

subclassFeature.name: Bodies and Bones
entries: {@i 3rd-level Reanimation feature}
You learn the {@spell Reanimate Bones|KyvumsNecromancer} spell. You can cast this spell once per {@variantrule Long Rest} or use any Spell Slot.
Upon defeating an enemy that has bones, spend 10 minutes and roll {@dice 1d6} + your Intelligence modifier, you collect that many {@item Bone|KyvumsNecromancer|Bones} from the corpse.
You control an amount or size of creatures dependent on the amount of bones used as per the Class Progression Table.

subclassFeature.name: Flesh on Bone
entries: {@i 6th-level Reanimation feature}
You learn the art of moulding, binding and animating flesh to bone.
Using the corpse of a creature that has flesh, you are able to bind the flesh to one of your controlled Reanimated Bones.
This process will take you 10 minutes.
A Reanimated Bone that has this effect applied will receive an additional 1 hitpoint per size category per Necromancer Level.

subclassFeature.name: Armor of Bone
entries: {@i 10th-level Reanimation feature}
You learn to animate bone as if it were a moving carapace to protect yourself or one of your animated creatures.
Requires {@status Concentration}.
{@i {@b Range:}} 60ft.
{@i {@b Duration:}} 8 hours
You can have up to 8 Bones worth of Armor of Bone active at any time.
The Armor of Bone will be destroyed if the creature it's protecting dies, you lose {@status Concentration}, it's duration expires or move out of range of the Armor of Bone.
If destroyed, none of the bones are salvageable.
Depending on how many bones you animate you can create carapace of different strengths:

items: {@i {@b 2 Bones:}} Armor equivalent to {@item Ring Mail|XPHB}
{@i {@b 4 Bones:}} Armor equivalent to {@item Chain Shirt|XPHB}
{@i {@b 6 Bones:}} Armor equivalent to {@item Chain Mail|XPHB}
{@i {@b 8 Bones:}} Armor equivalent to {@item Splint Armor|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Muscle and Mass
entries: {@i 14th-level Reanimation feature}

When binding Flesh to Bone as per the {@subclassFeature Flesh on Bone|Necromancer|KyvumsNecromancer|Reanimation|KyvumsNecromancer|6|KyvumsNecromancer|Flesh on Bone} feature you are now able to also bind muscle to one of your reanimations.
This grants the reanimation a bonus additional 5 feet of movement.
Additionally the creature now gains 2 hitpoints per size category per Necromancer level instead of 1.

subclassFeature.name: Hexmaster
entries: {@i 3rd-level Curses feature}
You are able to cast the {@spell Hex|XPHB} spell once without expending a spell slot, this is recharged upon a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
This does not count against your prepared spells.
At Higher Levels you are able to cast {@spell Hex|XPHB} multiple times before requiring a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} as per the Hexes and Curses column in the Class Progression Table.

{@i {@b Harrowing:}} Additionally the {@spell Hex|XPHB} spell's damage die becomes a {@dice 1d8} and can be triggered by anyone attacking the target. However it can now only be triggered once per turn.
This damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each spell slot above level 1.

subclassFeature.name: Cursemaster
entries: {@i 6th-level Curses feature}
You are able to cast the {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} spell once without expending a spell slot, this is recharged upon a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
This does not count against your prepared spells.
At Higher Levels you are able to cast {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} multiple times before requiring a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} as per the Class Progression Table.
Your {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} spell always applies it's damage element as well as one of the other options of your choice.

Additionally {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} gains the benefits of {@i {@b Harrowing}} from your {@subclassFeature Hexmaster|Necromancer|KyvumsNecromancer|Cursing|KyvumsNecromancer|3|KyvumsNecromancer|Hexmaster} feature with a damage die of {@dice 1d10}.

subclassFeature.name: Plague Spreader
entries: {@i 10th-level Curses feature}
Your hexes spread to enemies near the afflicted liked a plague.

If a creature afflicted by either of your {@spell Hex|XPHB} or {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} spells ends it's turn within 5ft of a creature it considers an ally, that creature is also afflicted by the spell.
A maximum of three creatures can be afflicted by either of your {@spell Hex|XPHB} or {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} spell at any time.

subclassFeature.name: Deathbringer
entries: {@i 14th-level Curses feature}
Creatures afflicted by your {@spell Hex|XPHB} or {@spell Bestow Curse|XPHB} spells are with intense pain as their bodies begin to erode.
At the beginning of each of their turns, any creature affected by one of these spells must make a Constitution {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} or take damage equal to that of the Hex or Curse.

subclassFeature.name: Soulrend
entries: {@i 3rd-level Reaper feature}
Your attacks siphon the soul of your enemies when charged with Necromantic energies.
You know the {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} cantrip, this does not count against your known cantrips.
You can now channel {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} through your weapon, when you successfully hit a target with {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} you additionally deal your weapon's damage.

If your {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} slays an enemy, gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the amount of damage dealt by the {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB}. The {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} last permanently until lost through damage.

You gain proficiency with {@filter Medium Armor|items|type=Medium Armor} and all {@filter Reach Weapons|items|property=Reach} and do not incur disadvantage when using {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} with Heavy weapons that also have the Reach property.

subclassFeature.name: Forbidden Wrath
entries: {@i 6th-level Reaper feature}
You are able to cast the {@spell Wrathful Smite|XPHB} spell once without expending a spell slot, this is recharged upon a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
This does not count against your prepared spells.
At Higher Levels you are able to cast {@spell Wrathful Smite|XPHB} multiple times before requiring a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} as per the Forbidden Magicks on the Class Progression Table.

If you cast {@spell Wrathful Smite|XPHB} after hitting an enemy with your {@subclassFeature Soulrend|Necromancer|KyvumsNecromancer|Reaping|KyvumsNecromancer|3|KyvumsNecromancer|Soulrend} and it dies, you still gain the {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Drain and Wither
entries: {@i 10th-level Reaper feature}
You are able to cast the {@spell Vampiric Touch|XPHB} spell once without expending a spell slot, this is recharged upon a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
This does not count against your prepared spells.
At Higher Levels you are able to cast {@spell Vampiric Touch|XPHB} multiple times before requiring a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} as per the Forbidden Magicks on the Class Progression Table.

Enemies slain by your {@spell Vampiric Touch|XPHB} can be used in place of {@spell Chill Touch|XPHB} for your {@subclassFeature Soulrend|Necromancer|KyvumsNecromancer|Reaping|KyvumsNecromancer|3|KyvumsNecromancer|Soulrend} feature.

subclassFeature.name: Creeping Darkness
entries: {@i 14th-level Reaper feature}
You gain 60 feet of {@sense Darkvision|XPHB}.
In Darkness you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on your melee attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Totemcraft
entries: {@i 3rd-level Chieftain feature}
You learn to craft {@item Totem|KyvumsShaman|Totems} capable of channeling magic from powerful spirits

You can craft up to 2 {@item Totem|KyvumsShaman|Totems} during a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} as you enter a meditative trance, or 1 during a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}. Outside of rests, crafting takes 1 hour per {@item Totem|KyvumsShaman}.
Each {@item Totem|KyvumsShaman} weighs 6 lbs and costs 5 cp in materials to craft.

At 3rd Level you can maintain charge on one Totem at a time, this increases to two at 12th Level and three at 18th Level. Maintaining charge requires a {@action Magic|XPHB} Action each turn and {@status Concentration}. If concentration breaks, you must use both {@action Magic|XPHB} Action and {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} next turn to regain it or your Totem is destroyed.
Totems can be deployed to occupy a 5ft space or wielded, deployed {@item Totem|KyvumsShaman|Totems} automatically fail Dexterity {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|Saving Throws}

Deployed Totems that are charged have their hit points linked to yours and have the same {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} as you; if {@variantrule Area of Effect|XPHB} damage hits both, you take damage for both. A Totem is destroyed if you take more than half your hit points in damage in one turn, if the linked damage would drop you to or below 0 HP, you drop to 1 instead and the Totem is destroyed. This can only occur once per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

When wielded, a {@item Totem|KyvumsShaman} can be used as a two-handed weapon you are proficient with and can be used as a spellcasting focus. A wielded {@item Totem|KyvumsShaman} also does not take damage.

subclassFeature.name: Totem of Consonance
entries: {@i 3rd-level Chieftain feature}
{@i {@b Totem Range:}} 60ft
Charge a Totem of Consonance: Your Calls provide both their boon to allies and hindrance to enemies simultaneously.

subclassFeature.name: Call of the Ancestors
entries: {@i 6th-level Chieftain feature}
{@i {@b Range:}} 30ft
{@i {@b Duration:}} 1 minute
{@b Choose one:}
Confer a boon to an ally, enemies have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} attacking them.
Hinder a foe, allies have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attacks against them.

subclassFeature.name: Totem of Flow
entries: {@i 10th-level Chieftain feature}
{@i {@b Totem Radius:}} 60ft
{@i {@b Duration:}} 1 minute
Charge a Totem of Flow: Enemies within the totem's radius must make a Constitution save against your Shaman Spellcaster DC. each turn or take damage equal to your Wisdom modifier + proficiency bonus.
You can then grant that amount as {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} to an ally, you can do this an amount of times equal to your Proficiency Bonus per turn.

subclassFeature.name: Totem of Cycles
entries: {@i 18th-level Chieftain feature}
{@i {@b Totem Radius:}} 30ft
Charge a Totem of Cycles: Each turn, choose a boon for an ally or a hindrance for a foe lasting until your next turn. Each effect can be used once every 3 turns.

items.name: Boons
entries: Bonus to all {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB} equal to Shaman’s wisdom modifier.
Bonus to Damage rolls equal to Shaman’s wisdom modifier.
Bonus to {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equal to Shaman’s wisdom modifier.
Bonus to one {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} of choice equal to half of Shaman’s proficiency bonus.
{@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to Shaman’s wisdom modifier plus proficiency bonus.

items.name: Hindrances
entries: Reduction to all {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB} equal to Shaman’s wisdom modifier.
Reduction to all Damage rolls equal to Shaman’s wisdom modifier.
Reduction to {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equal to Shaman’s wisdom modifier.
Reduction to one {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} of choice equal to half of Shaman’s proficiency bonus.
Damage equal to Shaman’s wisdom modifier plus proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Chief’s Totem
entries: {@i 20th-level Chieftain feature}
{@i {@b Totem Radius:}} 60ft
Charge the Chief’s Totem, you cannot have any other charged totems while the Chief's Totem is charged.
Allies within the radius of the totem gain a bonus to attack and damage rolls equal to your Wisdom modifier + proficiency bonus.

Once per turn, choose an ally to gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to 10 + your Wisdom modifier + proficiency bonus; enemies adjacent to that ally must make a Wisdom save or become {@condition frightened} of them.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Guide
entries: {@i 3rd-level Animist feature}

Choose a {@b permanent Spirit Animal Guide} when you gain this feature: Bear, Puma, Eagle, Wolf, or Owl. Each grants unique benefits and a skill in which you gain proficiency, if you already have proficiency in that skill choose another from the Shaman proficiency list:

items.name: Bear
entries: The Bear's spirit grants you a thickened hide and improved stamina. Your hit die becomes a d10 and you add 4 to your maximum hit points; at future levels, you receive 6 + your Constitution modifier for determining hit points.
Proficiency: Intimidation

items.name: Puma
entries: The guidance of the Puma enhances your agility and martial ability in close combat. You gain proficiency with melee martial weapons and can learn one of the {@variantrule weapon mastery properties|XPHB} with a melee weapon, which you can change upon leveling up.
Proficiency: Stealth

items.name: Eagle
entries: The Eagle's spirit improves your vision and ability with ranged weaponry. You gain proficiency with ranged martial weapons and can learn one of the {@variantrule weapon mastery properties|XPHB} with a ranged weapon, which you can change upon leveling up.
Proficiency: Perception

items.name: Wolf
entries: The Wolf guide improves your groupthink, working tactically with your allies to win battles. When within 5 feet of an ally, you both gain +1 to your {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB}. You can confer this bonus to multiple allies but do not gain multiple instances of the bonus.
Proficiency: Athletics

items.name: Owl
entries: The wisdom of the Owl provides you with great foresight and improved ability in darkness. You gain 60 feet of {@sense Darkvision|XPHB}.
Proficiency: Insight
These benefits reflect your bond with your chosen spirit, cannot be changed and remain with you {@b permanently}.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Guidance
entries: {@i 6th-level Animist feature}
Your connection to your spirit deepens, enhancing its power and allowing you to use your Calls as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. Additionally, your spirit grants the following upgrades:

items.name: Bear
entries: Gain an amount of {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to two times your Shaman level while you have an active Call.
These {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} are restored at the start of each of your turns.
At 12th level, you also gain +1 {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}.

items.name: Puma
entries: Gain the Extra Attack feature: you can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} Action on your turn.
At 12th level, your climb speed becomes equal to your walking speed.

items.name: Eagle
entries: Gain the Extra Attack feature: you can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} Action on your turn.
At 12th level, your ranged attacks ignore up to half cover.

items.name: Wolf
entries: If an ally within 5 feet of you attacks a foe also within 5 feet of you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to attack that target.
At 12th level, you gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on this {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} attack and confer {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} to the ally who made the attack on their next attack.

items.name: Owl
entries: Each turn you successfully hit an enemy or they fail a {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} from one of your spells, you gain a stacking +1 bonus damage with your next spell or attack. This resets upon missing and stacks up to your Wisdom modifier.
At 12th level, the bonus becomes +2 per stack and can stack up to double your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Call of the Wild
entries: {@i 10th-level Animist feature}
Your spirit animal fills you and your party with power.
{@i {@b Range:}} 30ft
{@i {@b Duration:}} 1 minute

items.name: Bear
entries: Receive +1 {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}.

items.name: Puma
entries: Gain a bonus to Dexterity skill checks and {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|Saving Throws} equal to your Wisdom modifier.

items.name: Eagle
entries: Your next attack deals {@damage 1d8} bonus weapon damage to the last target you struck with a ranged weapon attack.

items.name: Wolf
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on weapon attacks.

items.name: Owl
entries: Gain 60 feet of {@sense Darkvision|XPHB}. This is cumulative for you with the {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} gained from the Spirit Guide feature.

subclassFeature.name: Bestial Trance
entries: {@i 18th-level Animist feature}
Battle has become a trancelike state where your mind and body are supplemented by the guidance of your spirit animal.

items.name: Bear
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you let loose a bestial roar. Make an {@skill Intimidation|XPHB} check; all enemies engaged with you who can hear must make a Wisdom {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB} against your roll or become {@condition frightened} of you.

items.name: Puma
entries: You can Disengage or Dash as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

items.name: Eagle
entries: Gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on ranged attacks made while you are at least 10 feet above your target.

items.name: Wolf
entries: When you use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} from {@subclassFeature Enhanced Guidance|Shaman|KyvumsShaman|Animist|KyvumsShaman|6|KyvumsShaman|Enhanced Guidance} to attack and hit, the ally you assisted gains {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on their next attack.

items.name: Owl
entries: Gain 30 feet of {@sense Truesight|XPHB}. When you use {@subclassFeature Call of the Wild|Shaman|KyvumsShaman|Animist|KyvumsShaman|10|KyvumsShaman|Call of the Wild}, allies affected also gain this {@sense Truesight|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Convergence
entries: {@i 20th-level Animist feature}
Your spirit animal has become entwined with your spirit. You now embody the full extent of its power.

items.name: Bear
entries: Your maximum hit points increase by 21, your hit die becomes d12, and your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} bonus from {@subclassFeature Enhanced Guidance|Shaman|KyvumsShaman|Animist|KyvumsShaman|6|KyvumsShaman|Enhanced Guidance} becomes +2.

items.name: Puma
entries: You deal an extra {@damage 1d10} weapon damage on the first attack you hit with each round. Your run speed increases by 10 feet.

items.name: Eagle
entries: Your long jump distance is tripled, your jump height is doubled.

items.name: Wolf
entries: The {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB} bonus from your Spirit Guide feature increases to +3.

items.name: Owl
entries: You learn a foe’s weaknesses, resistances, and immunities when using the Spirit Guide feature. You can also cast {@spell detect thoughts} without expending a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Stormsurge
entries: {@i 3rd-level Stormseer feature}
You learn the {@spell Stormsurge|KyvumsShaman|Stormsurge Cantrip}, which does not count against your known {@variantrule Cantrip|XPHB|Cantrips}.

subclassFeature.name: Power of Storms
entries: {@i 3rd-level Stormseer feature}
You gain additional spells at certain levels, which are always prepared and don’t count against your prepared spells:

entries.caption: Stormseer Bonus Spells
rows: {@spell sleet storm}, {@spell call lightning}, {@spell wind wall}

entries: Additionally, you gain proficiency in the Survival skill, if you already have proficiency in Survival choose a different proficiency from the Shaman proficiency list.

subclassFeature.name: Call of the Storm
entries: {@i 6th-level Stormseer feature}
As an action, you create a storm of wind, thunder or lightning on a space you can see.
Requires {@status Concentration}
{@i {@b Range:}} 60ft
{@i {@b Radius:}} 10ft sphere
{@i {@b Duration:}} 1 minute

items: Hurricane: Push enemies 5ft counterclockwise each turn, if they collide with anything both take {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage. The Hurricane is difficult terrain. Increases to {@damage 2d8} at Level 12.

Thunder: Deafening blasts echo throughout the storm dealing {@damage 1d6} thunder damage to all who begin their turn in the storm. Any who take damage must roll a Constitution save vs. your spellcaster DC or be {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. Increases to  {@damage 2d6} at Level 12.

Lightning: Powerful blasts of lightning explode each turn in the storm. Anyone caught in the storm must make a Dexterity save vs. your spellcaster DC or take 2d6 damage. Increases to {@damage 4d6} at Level 12.

subclassFeature.name: Splinterstorm
entries: {@i 10th-level Stormseer feature}

When you hit a creature with {@spell Stormsurge|KyvumsShaman}, you can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to target a second creature within 20 feet of the first, making another spell attack against them with Stormsurge.
Additionally, when you cast a spell that deals lightning, thunder, or wind damage, you can cast {@spell Stormsurge|KyvumsShaman} as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on the same turn.

subclassFeature.name: Eye of the Storm
entries: {@i 18th-level Stormseer feature}
You gain immunity to damage from your own lightning, thunder, and wind spells.

While you are inside a natural Storm or magical Storm of a spell that you have casted, you can redirect the damage or effect to a creature of your choice within the area instead of yourself, also your Splinterstorm can now splinter an additional time.

subclassFeature.name: Windwalker
entries: {@i 20th-level Stormseer feature}
You gain a flying speed of 60 feet, and you become immune to lightning and thunder damage.
Additionally, while you are inside a natural Storm or magical Storm of a spell that you have casted, the damage die for your {@spell Stormsurge|KyvumsShaman} increases from a d10 to a d12.

item.name: Bone
entries: A bone harvested from a corpse.

item.name: Totem
entries: If a wielded Totem is not charged it's damage die becomes a {@damage 1d4} and it also has the {@footnote Heavy|You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB} with a Heavy weapon if it's a Melee weapon and your Strength score isn't at least 13 or if it's a Ranged weapon and your Dexterity score isn't at least 13.} property.

spell.name: Reanimate Bones
entries: You reanimate the bones of the dead to do your bidding as per the Reanimated Bones stat blocks.
The reanimated bones take the form of a creature of your choice depending on how many bones were used in the ritual.
If two bones are used, the creature must be {@creature Reanimated Bones: Small|KyvumsNecromancer|small} in size.
If four bones are used, the creature must be {@creature Reanimated Bones: Medium|KyvumsNecromancer|medium} in size.
If six bones are used, the creature must be {@creature Reanimated Bones: Large|KyvumsNecromancer|large} in size.
If eight bones are used, the creature must be {@creature Reanimated Bones: Huge|KyvumsNecromancer|huge} in size.

spell.name: Stormsurge
entries: Make a ranged spell attack; on a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} lightning, thunder, or bludgeoning damage of your choice. Choose the damage type before the {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB} .

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d10}), 11 ({@dice 3d10}), and 17 ({@dice 4d10}).

trait.name: Opposable Thumbs
entries: All creatures you create have Opposable Thumbs and are able to wield Simple Weapons.

action.name: Unarmed Attack
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: Bonus equals your Spell Attack Modifier, reach 5 ft.
On Hit Damage: {@damage 1d4 + 2} plus your Intelligence modifier Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage (your choice, depending on the form of the bones).

action.name: Armed Attack
entries: Weapon Attack: Bonus equals your Spell Attack Modifier.
On Hit Damage: Equal to the Weapon's Damage plus your Intelligence modifier, damage type depends on weapon.

trait.name: Opposable Thumbs
entries: All creatures you create have Opposable Thumbs and are able to wield Simple Weapons.

trait.name: Structured Body
entries: All of your medium reanimated creations are created with a structured body, they are capable of wearing light armor.

action.name: Unarmed Attack
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: Bonus equals your Spell Attack Modifier, reach 5 ft.
On Hit Damage: {@damage 1d6 + 2} plus your Intelligence modifier Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage (your choice, depending on the form of the bones).

action.name: Armed Attack
entries: Weapon Attack: Bonus equals your Spell Attack Modifier.
On Hit Damage: Equal to the Weapon's Damage plus your Intelligence modifier, damage type depends on weapon.

trait.name: Opposable Thumbs
entries: All creatures you create have Opposable Thumbs and are able to wield Simple Weapons.

trait.name: Structured and Solid Body
entries: Your large reanimated creations are not only structured but solid also, they are capable of wearing medium armor.

trait.name: Unarmed Attack
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: Bonus equals your Spell Attack Modifier, reach 5 ft.
On Hit Damage: {@damage 1d8 + 2} plus your Intelligence modifier Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage (your choice, depending on the form of the bones).

action.name: Armed Attack
entries: Weapon Attack: Bonus equals your Spell Attack Modifier.
On Hit Damage: Equal to the Weapon's Damage plus your Intelligence modifier, damage type depends on weapon.

trait.name: Opposable Thumbs
entries: All of your reanimated creations have Opposable Thumbs and are able to wield Simple Weapons.

trait.name: Structured and Sturdy Body
entries: Your huge reanimated creations are not only structured but sturdy also, they are capable of wearing heavy armor.
Due to it's size, the armor must be custom ordered and the cost is four times the normal cost, and it weighs twice as much.

trait.name: Unarmed Attack
entries: Melee Weapon Attack: Bonus equals your Spell Attack Modifier, reach 5 ft.
On Hit Damage: {@damage 1d10 + 2} plus your Intelligence modifier Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage (your choice, depending on the form of the bones).

action.name: Armed Attack
entries: Weapon Attack: Bonus equals your Spell Attack Modifier.
On Hit Damage: Equal to the Weapon's Damage plus your Intelligence modifier, damage type depends on weapon.
